instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPV5_S3: What is PPV5_S3? This is a typo of PP5V_S3 When you see PPV5_S3, assume they meant to type PP5V_S3.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: [SOLVED]missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello,
first of all sorry for my bad english ;). I have a Problem with an older <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. It has a green light on the charger but didn´t turn on. I short the pads on <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR> but nothing happens. Than i checked the Powerrails and <SIGNAL>PPV5_S3</SIGNAL> is 0V (everything til there was fine). I followed this path to <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>. Vin of <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> is 12,6V, Vref is 1,9V, Entrip2 is 0,7V (i guess thats ok) and Entrip1 is 0V. (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> on right side of <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> is there) I followed Entrip1 to <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> and came to the conclusion, that i need <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> to get Entrip1 pass <CHIP>U7210</CHIP>. Pin 5 (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>) is 0V. Than i checked if <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5_MCP</SIGNAL> turns the MCP on and it´s reading is 1,1V. <CHIP>U7750</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> seem to be fine to. I can´t see any waterdamage or other visible damage on the board. At this point i don´t know where to look next. It would be realy great if someone could give me an advice what to check next in a case like this. 
Best regards
Felix

threads.title: [SOLVED]missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Doe <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> toggle when you short the power pads?
Oh and the obvious one, are you using a REAL GENUINE APPLE 85W charger?

threads.title: [SOLVED]missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Thank you for your fast reply! I´ll check this on monday and let you know. Charger should be original. I have 3 different, i´ll check that also

threads.title: [SOLVED]missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello,
the charger is original apple. I don´t know why but in the moment as i was measuring and shorting the pads at the same time <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> droped from 3,4V to 0V and the board srarts to spin the fans and seems to work normally. I shorted the pads many times bevore and noting happend so i have no idea wat fixes it. Is this commom failure and will it have this problem again in near future?
Thank you very much for your help
Felix

threads.title: [SOLVED]missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Replace <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> to be sure that it will not fail again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I replaced <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>. Thank you for your help!
